short_summary: Dry docking and alterations of the Department of Fisheries and Oceans vessel CCGS Jean Goodwill
description: The Contractor must carry out the docking, maintenance and alterations of the Department of Fisheries and Oceans vessel CCGS Jean Goodwill in accordance with the Requirement at Annex  u201cAu201d; carry out any approved unscheduled work not covered in the above paragraph; note that the Federal Contractors Program (FCP) for employment equity applies to this procurement; refer to Part 5 u2013 Certifications and Additional Information, Part 7 - Resulting Contract Clauses and the annex titled Federal Contractors Program for Employment Equity - Certification; note that this bid solicitation requires that bids only be submitted through CanadaBuys (SAP Ariba). All bids submitted through other means will neither be accepted nor considered. Bidders must refer to Part 2 entitled Bidder Instructions, and Part 3 entitled Bid Preparation Instructions, of the bid solicitation, for further information.
full_summary:
**CCGS Jean Goodwill Dry Docking Refit Solicitation**
================================.getvalue======================

**Solicitation Information**

*   Reference Number: WS3985461523-Doc3985543914
*   Solicitation Number: WS3985461523
*   Solicitation Title: CCGS Jean Goodwill Dry Docking Refit
*   Publication Date: April 28, 2023
*   Tender Closing Date: May 30, 2023, at 14:00:00
*   Amendment Date: May 25, 2023
*   Expected Contract Start Date: June 15, 2023
*   Expected Contract End Date: Not specified

**Tender Status**

*   The tender closed on the specified date.
*   Bids are no longer being accepted.

**Overview and Objective**

*   The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) is soliciting bids for the dry docking, maintenance, and alterations of the Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO) vessel, CCGS Jean Goodwill.
*   The successful bidder will be required to carry out the work in accordance with the requirement outlined in Annex “A” of the bid solicitation.
*   Bidders are required to refer to Part 2, Bidder Instructions, for further information on submitting their tender.

**Scope of Work**

*   The scope of work includes the installation of marine craft systems and subassemblies.
*   The successful bidder must also carry out unscheduled work not covered in the above scope.
*   Any approved unscheduled work must be carried out in accordance with the terms of the contract.

**Eligibility and Evaluation Criteria**

*   The eligibility criteria for this tender require bidders to be Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) compliant.
*   The evaluation criteria for this tender will be based on the Lowest Price method.
*   Bidders must be aware that this bid solicitation requires that bids only be submitted through CanadaBuys (SAP Ariba).

**Additional Information**

*   Please refer to Part 5 – Certifications and Additional Information and Part 7: Resulting Contract Clauses of the bid solicitation.
*   Bidders must be aware of the Federal Contractors Program (FCP) for employment equity, which applies to this procurement.

Contact Information
------------------

*   For any questions or concerns regarding this tender, please contact Dave Dunne, (SPAC/PSPC) at [dave.dun
